part_name: Appendix Temporary Work – Government Authorised Exchange

metadata.source: Appendix Temporary Work – Government Authorised Exchange
metadata.part: Appendix Temporary Work – Government Authorised Exchange
metadata.section_title: Validity requirements for the Government Authorised Exchange route

chunks.text:
### Validity requirements for the Government Authorised Exchange route

GAE 1.1. A person applying for entry clearance or permission to stay on the Government Authorised Exchange route must apply online on the gov.uk website on the specified form ‘Temporary Work – Government Authorised Exchange Scheme’.

1.   GAE 1.2. An application for entry clearance or permission to stay on the Government Authorised Exchange route must meet all the following requirements: 
    1.   (a) any fee and Immigration Health Charge must have been paid; and
    2.   (b) the applicant must have provided biometrics when required; and
    3.   (c) the applicant must have provided a passport or other travel document which satisfactorily establishes their identity and nationality; and
    4.   (d) the applicant must have a Certificate of Sponsorship that was issued to them no more than 3 months (or 90 days, where the Certificate of Sponsorship is linked to a Sponsorship Reference Number, disregarding any days during which an edit requested by a sponsor to their Sponsor a Worker submission is being reviewed) before the date of application.

GAE 1.3. If the applicant has in the last 12 months before the date of application received an award from a Government or international scholarship agency covering both fees and maintenance, they must provide written consent to the application from that Government or agency.

GAE 1.4. An application which does not meet all the validity requirements for the Government Authorised Exchange route may be rejected as invalid and not considered.
chunks.summary: Applicants seeking entry or stay under the Government Authorised Exchange route must apply online, pay fees, provide biometrics, a valid passport, and a recent Certificate of Sponsorship (issued within 90 days). If they received a government or international scholarship in the past year covering fees and maintenance, they must also submit written consent from the issuer.

### Validity requirements for the Government Authorised Exchange route

GAE 1.1. A person applying for entry clearance or permission to stay on the Government Authorised Exchange route must apply online on the gov.uk website on the specified form ‘Temporary Work – Government Authorised Exchange Scheme’.

1.   GAE 1.2. An application for entry clearance or permission to stay on the Government Authorised Exchange route must meet all the following requirements: 
    1.   (a) any fee and Immigration Health Charge must have been paid; and
    2.   (b) the applicant must have provided biometrics when required; and
    3.   (c) the applicant must have provided a passport or other travel document which satisfactorily establishes their identity and nationality; and
    4.   (d) the applicant must have a Certificate of Sponsorship that was issued to them no more than 3 months (or 90 days, where the Certificate of Sponsorship is linked to a Sponsorship Reference Number, disregarding any days during which an edit requested by a sponsor to their Sponsor a Worker submission is being reviewed) before the date of application.

GAE 1.3. If the applicant has in the last 12 months before the date of application received an award from a Government or international scholarship agency covering both fees and maintenance, they must provide written consent to the application from that Government or agency.

GAE 1.4. An application which does not meet all the validity requirements for the Government Authorised Exchange route may be rejected as invalid and not considered.

metadata.source: Appendix Temporary Work – Government Authorised Exchange
metadata.part: Appendix Temporary Work – Government Authorised Exchange
metadata.section_title: Suitability requirements for the Government Authorised Exchange route

chunks.text:
### Suitability requirements for the Government Authorised Exchange route

GAE 2.1. The applicant must not fall for refusal under Part Suitability.

1.   GAE 2.2. If applying for permission to stay the applicant must not be: 
    1.   (a) in breach of immigration laws, except that where the Exceptions for overstayers section of Part Suitability applies, that period of overstaying will be disregarded; or
    2.   (b) on immigration bail.
chunks.summary: Applicants seeking permission under the Government Authorised Exchange route must meet suitability criteria, not breach immigration laws (with certain overstaying exceptions), and not be on immigration bail.

metadata.section_id: Eligibility requirements for the Government Authorised Exchange route
metadata.section_title: Eligibility requirements for the Government Authorised Exchange route

chunks.text: ### Eligibility requirements for the Government Authorised Exchange route
chunks.summary: This provision applies to applicants seeking entry via the Government Authorised Exchange route. It requires applicants to meet specific eligibility criteria, including sponsorship and compliance with prescribed conditions. Exceptions or thresholds are not specified in this summary.
chunks.augmented_text:
Document: Appendix Temporary Work – Government Authorised Exchange

Section ID: Eligibility requirements for the Government Authorised Exchange route
Section: Eligibility requirements for the Government Authorised Exchange route
Topic: eligibility

Summary: This provision applies to applicants seeking entry via the Government Authorised Exchange route. It requires applicants to meet specific eligibility criteria, including sponsorship and compliance with prescribed conditions. Exceptions or thresholds are not specified in this summary.

### Eligibility requirements for the Government Authorised Exchange route

metadata.source: Appendix Temporary Work – Government Authorised Exchange
metadata.part: Appendix Temporary Work – Government Authorised Exchange
metadata.section_title: Entry requirements for the Government Authorised Exchange route

chunks.text:
### Entry requirements for the Government Authorised Exchange route

GAE 3.1. A person seeking to come to the UK on the Government Authorised Exchange route must have applied for and obtained entry clearance on the Government Authorised Exchange route before they arrive in the UK.

GAE 3.2. A person applying for entry clearance on the Government Authorised Exchange route must, if Appendix Tuberculosis applies, provide a valid medical certificate confirming that they have undergone screening for active pulmonary tuberculosis and that this tuberculosis is not present in them.
chunks.summary: Applicants seeking entry on the Government Authorised Exchange route must obtain prior entry clearance before arrival and, if applicable, provide a TB screening certificate confirming they do not have active pulmonary tuberculosis.

### Entry requirements for the Government Authorised Exchange route

GAE 3.1. A person seeking to come to the UK on the Government Authorised Exchange route must have applied for and obtained entry clearance on the Government Authorised Exchange route before they arrive in the UK.

GAE 3.2. A person applying for entry clearance on the Government Authorised Exchange route must, if Appendix Tuberculosis applies, provide a valid medical certificate confirming that they have undergone screening for active pulmonary tuberculosis and that this tuberculosis is not present in them.

metadata.source: Appendix Temporary Work – Government Authorised Exchange
metadata.part: Appendix Temporary Work – Government Authorised Exchange
metadata.section_title: Previous permission requirement for the Government Authorised Exchange route

chunks.text:
### Previous permission requirement for the Government Authorised Exchange route

1.   GAE 4.1. An applicant who is applying for permission to stay must be in the UK on the date of application and must have, or have last been granted: 
    1.   (a) permission on the Government Authorised Exchange route; or
    2.   (b) permission as a Student, who meets the requirements in GAE 4.2. and who is or was last sponsored by either: 
        1.   (i) a higher education provider with a track record of compliance; or
        2.   (ii) an overseas higher education institution, to do a short-term study abroad programme in the UK.

1.   GAE 4.2. Where the applicant has, or last had, permission as a Student: 
    1.   (a) the applicant must have completed a UK recognised bachelor’s or postgraduate degree during that last period of permission; and
    2.   (b) the applicant must currently be sponsored for either: 
        1.   (i) a period of postgraduate professional training or work experience which is required to gain a professional qualification or registration in the same field as their degree; or
        2.   (ii) an internship for up to 12 months which is directly related to their degree; and

    3.   (c) the applicant must not be filling a permanent vacancy; and
    4.   (d) the sponsor must not intend to employ the applicant in the UK once the training or work experience is completed.
chunks.summary: Applicants must currently be in the UK with permission via the Government Authorised Exchange route or as a qualifying student sponsor. If previously a student, they must have completed a UK recognized degree and be sponsored for relevant training, work experience, or internship related to their degree, without filling a permanent vacancy or intending UK employment afterward.

If previously a student, they must have completed a UK recognized degree and be sponsored for relevant training, work experience, or internship related to their degree, without filling a permanent vacancy or intending UK employment afterward.

### Previous permission requirement for the Government Authorised Exchange route

1.   GAE 4.1. An applicant who is applying for permission to stay must be in the UK on the date of application and must have, or have last been granted: 
    1.   (a) permission on the Government Authorised Exchange route; or
    2.   (b) permission as a Student, who meets the requirements in GAE 4.2. and who is or was last sponsored by either: 
        1.   (i) a higher education provider with a track record of compliance; or
        2.   (ii) an overseas higher education institution, to do a short-term study abroad programme in the UK.

1.   GAE 4.2. Where the applicant has, or last had, permission as a Student: 
    1.   (a) the applicant must have completed a UK recognised bachelor’s or postgraduate degree during that last period of permission; and
    2.   (b) the applicant must currently be sponsored for either: 
        1.   (i) a period of postgraduate professional training or work experience which is required to gain a professional qualification or registration in the same field as their degree; or
        2.   (ii) an internship for up to 12 months which is directly related to their degree; and

    3.   (c) the applicant must not be filling a permanent vacancy; and
    4.   (d) the sponsor must not intend to employ the applicant in the UK once the training or work experience is completed.

metadata.source: Appendix Temporary Work – Government Authorised Exchange
metadata.part: Appendix Temporary Work – Government Authorised Exchange
metadata.section_title: Sponsorship requirement for the Government Authorised Exchange route

chunks.text:
### Sponsorship requirement for the Government Authorised Exchange route

1.   GAE 5.1. The applicant must have a valid Certificate of Sponsorship for the job they are planning to do; which to be valid must: 
    1.   (a) confirm the applicant’s name, that they are being sponsored on the Government Authorised Exchange route, details of the job and salary the sponsor is offering them, and that these arrangements comply with the National Minimum Wage; and
    2.   (b) include a start date, stated by the sponsor, which is no more than three months after the date of application; and
    3.   (c) not have been used in a previous application which was either granted or refused (but can have been used in a previous application which was rejected as invalid, made void or withdrawn); and
    4.   (d) not have been withdrawn by the sponsor or cancelled by the Home Office; and
    5.   (e) confirm that the role meets the requirements of the individual exchange scheme as set out in Appendix GAE schemes; and
    6.   (f) confirm that the role is supernumerary, such that it is in addition to the host employer’s regular, required, or standard number of staff and does not fill a permanent position or ongoing vacancy in the relevant organisation’s workforce, even on a temporary basis (with a full explanation of why it is supernumerary); and
    7.   (g) confirm that the role appears in Tables 1, 1a, 2, 2aa, 3 or 3a of Appendix Skilled Occupations; and
    8.   (h) confirm whether the Academic Technology Approval Scheme (ATAS) requirement in Appendix ATAS applies.

GAE 5.2. The sponsor must be authorised by the Home Office to sponsor individuals in the role specified on the Certificate of Sponsorship and on the particular scheme that the applicant has applied to participate in (as set out in Appendix GAE schemes).

GAE 5.3. The sponsor must be listed as A-rated on the Home Office’s register of licensed sponsors, unless the applicant was last granted permission on the Government Authorised Exchange route and is applying to continue working for the same sponsor as in their last permission.

GAE 5.4. The decision maker must not have reasonable grounds to believe the job the applicant is being sponsored to do does not comply with the National Minimum Wage Regulations or the Working Time Regulations.
chunks.summary: Applicants under the Government Authorized Exchange route must hold a valid Certificate of Sponsorship confirming job details, salary, and compliance with the National Minimum Wage, issued within three months of application. The sponsorship must not have been previously used, withdrawn, or canceled and must specify a supernumerary, scheme-compliant role listed in designated occupation tables.

The sponsorship must not have been previously used, withdrawn, or canceled and must specify a supernumerary, scheme-compliant role listed in designated occupation tables.

### Sponsorship requirement for the Government Authorised Exchange route

1.   GAE 5.1. The applicant must have a valid Certificate of Sponsorship for the job they are planning to do; which to be valid must: 
    1.   (a) confirm the applicant’s name, that they are being sponsored on the Government Authorised Exchange route, details of the job and salary the sponsor is offering them, and that these arrangements comply with the National Minimum Wage; and
    2.   (b) include a start date, stated by the sponsor, which is no more than three months after the date of application; and
    3.   (c) not have been used in a previous application which was either granted or refused (but can have been used in a previous application which was rejected as invalid, made void or withdrawn); and
    4.   (d) not have been withdrawn by the sponsor or cancelled by the Home Office; and
    5.   (e) confirm that the role meets the requirements of the individual exchange scheme as set out in Appendix GAE schemes; and
    6.   (f) confirm that the role is supernumerary, such that it is in addition to the host employer’s regular, required, or standard number of staff and does not fill a permanent position or ongoing vacancy in the relevant organisation’s workforce, even on a temporary basis (with a full explanation of why it is supernumerary); and
    7.   (g) confirm that the role appears in Tables 1, 1a, 2, 2aa, 3 or 3a of Appendix Skilled Occupations; and
    8.   (h) confirm whether the Academic Technology Approval Scheme (ATAS) requirement in Appendix ATAS applies.

GAE 5.2. The sponsor must be authorised by the Home Office to sponsor individuals in the role specified on the Certificate of Sponsorship and on the particular scheme that the applicant has applied to participate in (as set out in Appendix GAE schemes).

GAE 5.3. The sponsor must be listed as A-rated on the Home Office’s register of licensed sponsors, unless the applicant was last granted permission on the Government Authorised Exchange route and is applying to continue working for the same sponsor as in their last permission.

GAE 5.4. The decision maker must not have reasonable grounds to believe the job the applicant is being sponsored to do does not comply with the National Minimum Wage Regulations or the Working Time Regulations.

metadata.source: Appendix Temporary Work – Government Authorised Exchange
metadata.part: Appendix Temporary Work – Government Authorised Exchange
metadata.section_title: Genuineness requirement for the Government Authorised Exchange route

chunks.text:
### Genuineness requirement for the Government Authorised Exchange route

1.   GAE 6.1. The applicant must: 
    1.   (a) genuinely intend, and be able, to undertake the role for which they are being sponsored; and
    2.   (b) not intend to undertake employment other than in the role for which they are being sponsored, or as otherwise permitted by paragraph GAE 11.3.
chunks.summary: Applicants applying through the Government Authorised Exchange route must genuinely intend and be able to undertake their sponsored role, without plans to work outside this role unless permitted. They must also demonstrate that their intentions align with the stipulated employment scope.

    1.   (a) genuinely intend, and be able, to undertake the role for which they are being sponsored; and
    2.   (b) not intend to undertake employment other than in the role for which they are being sponsored, or as otherwise permitted by paragraph GAE 11.3.

metadata.source: Appendix Temporary Work – Government Authorised Exchange
metadata.part: Appendix Temporary Work – Government Authorised Exchange
metadata.section_title: ATAS requirement for the Government Authorised Exchange route

chunks.text:
### ATAS requirement for the Government Authorised Exchange route

GAE 7.1. If the ATAS requirement in Appendix ATAS applies, the applicant must provide a valid ATAS certificate.
chunks.summary: Applicants seeking entry via the Government Authorised Exchange route must provide a valid ATAS certificate if the ATAS requirement applies, with no specified exceptions.

Summary: Applicants seeking entry via the Government Authorised Exchange route must provide a valid ATAS certificate if the ATAS requirement applies, with no specified exceptions.

### ATAS requirement for the Government Authorised Exchange route

GAE 7.1. If the ATAS requirement in Appendix ATAS applies, the applicant must provide a valid ATAS certificate.

metadata.source: Appendix Temporary Work – Government Authorised Exchange
metadata.part: Appendix Temporary Work – Government Authorised Exchange
metadata.section_title: Financial Requirement for the Government Authorised Exchange route

chunks.text:
### Financial Requirement for the Government Authorised Exchange route

GAE 8.1. If the applicant is applying for permission to stay and has been in the UK with permission for 12 months or longer on the date of application, they will meet the financial requirement and do not need to show funds.

1.   GAE 8.2. If the applicant is applying for entry clearance, or is applying for permission to stay and has been in the UK for less than 12 months on the date of application, either: 
    1.   (a) the applicant must have funds of at least £1,270; or
    2.   (b) the applicant’s A rated sponsor must confirm on the Certificate of Sponsorship that they will, if it is necessary, maintain and accommodate the applicant up to the end of the first month of their employment for an amount of at least £1,270.

GAE 8.3. If GAE 8.2. applies the applicant must show that they have held the required level of funds for a 28-day period and as specified in Appendix Finance.
chunks.summary: Applicants applying for the Government Authorised Exchange route must have held UK permission for 12 months or more to meet the financial requirement without proving funds; those with less than 12 months’ permission must either have at least £1,270 in funds or a sponsor’s confirmation to maintain and accommodate them. The funds must have been held for 28 days prior to application.

The funds must have been held for 28 days prior to application.

### Financial Requirement for the Government Authorised Exchange route

GAE 8.1. If the applicant is applying for permission to stay and has been in the UK with permission for 12 months or longer on the date of application, they will meet the financial requirement and do not need to show funds.

1.   GAE 8.2. If the applicant is applying for entry clearance, or is applying for permission to stay and has been in the UK for less than 12 months on the date of application, either: 
    1.   (a) the applicant must have funds of at least £1,270; or
    2.   (b) the applicant’s A rated sponsor must confirm on the Certificate of Sponsorship that they will, if it is necessary, maintain and accommodate the applicant up to the end of the first month of their employment for an amount of at least £1,270.

GAE 8.3. If GAE 8.2. applies the applicant must show that they have held the required level of funds for a 28-day period and as specified in Appendix Finance.

metadata.source: Appendix Temporary Work – Government Authorised Exchange

metadata.section_title: Parental consent requirement for the Government Authorised Exchange route

chunks.text:
### Parental consent requirement for the Government Authorised Exchange route

GAE 9.1. The applicant must meet the parental consent requirement for applicant not applying as a dependent child in Appendix Children.

GAE 9.2. DELETED.
chunks.summary: Applicants applying via the Government Authorised Exchange route must obtain parental consent if not applying as a dependent child under Appendix Children; this requirement ensures parental approval for minors participating in the scheme.

### Parental consent requirement for the Government Authorised Exchange route

GAE 9.1. The applicant must meet the parental consent requirement for applicant not applying as a dependent child in Appendix Children.

GAE 9.2. DELETED.

metadata.source: Appendix Temporary Work – Government Authorised Exchange
metadata.part: Appendix Temporary Work – Government Authorised Exchange
metadata.section_title: Decision on an application for the Government Authorised Exchange route

chunks.text:
### Decision on an application for the Government Authorised Exchange route

GAE 10.1. If the decision maker is satisfied that all the suitability and eligibility requirements for the Government Authorised Exchange route are met, the application will be granted, otherwise the application will be refused.

GAE 10.2. If the application is refused, the person can apply for an Administrative Review under Appendix AR: Administrative Review.
chunks.summary: Applicants for the Government Authorised Exchange route will be granted if they meet all suitability and eligibility requirements; otherwise, their application will be refused, with the option to request an Administrative Review.
chunks.augmented_text:

### Decision on an application for the Government Authorised Exchange route

GAE 10.1. If the decision maker is satisfied that all the suitability and eligibility requirements for the Government Authorised Exchange route are met, the application will be granted, otherwise the application will be refused.

GAE 10.2. If the application is refused, the person can apply for an Administrative Review under Appendix AR: Administrative Review.

metadata.source: Appendix Temporary Work – Government Authorised Exchange
metadata.part: Appendix Temporary Work – Government Authorised Exchange
metadata.section_title: Period of grant for the Government Authorised Exchange route

chunks.text:
### Period of grant for the Government Authorised Exchange route

GAE 11.1. If the application is for entry clearance, the applicant will be granted for the period of the role on the Certificate of Sponsorship plus up to 14 days before and 14 days after that period (the end date of the Certificate of Sponsorship may be up to the maximum period of time that a person is permitted to spend in the UK under the terms of the specific scheme on which the applicant has applied to participate in, as set out in Appendix GAE schemes).

1.   GAE 11.2. If the application is for permission to stay, the applicant will be granted for whichever is the shortest of: 
    1.   (a) the period of the role on the Certificate of Sponsorship plus 14 days after that period (the end date of the Certificate of Sponsorship may be up to the maximum period of time permitted under the terms of the specific scheme on which the applicant has applied to participate in, as set out in Appendix GAE schemes); or
    2.   (b) where the applicant is applying to continue to participate in the same scheme, a period of 14 days plus the difference between the maximum period of time that a person on the Government Authorised Exchange route is permitted to spend in the UK under the terms of the specific approved scheme on which the applicant had applied to participate in (as set out in Appendix GAE schemes) and the period that they have already been granted permission to participate in that scheme; or
    3.   (c) the difference between 25 months and the duration of the period during which the applicant has already held continuous permission on the Government Authorised Exchange route, including any period where the Exceptions for overstayers section of Part Suitability applied.
chunks.summary: This provision applies to applicants for the Government Authorised Exchange route. It specifies that entry clearance is granted for the role’s duration plus up to 14 days before and after, while permission to stay is limited to the shortest of the role’s duration plus 14 days, the remaining permitted scheme duration, or a 14-day extension. Critical conditions include adhering to the maximum permitted time under the specific scheme outlined in Appendix GAE schemes.
chunks.augmented_text:

Summary: This provision applies to applicants for the Government Authorised Exchange route. It specifies that entry clearance is granted for the role’s duration plus up to 14 days before and after, while permission to stay is limited to the shortest of the role’s duration plus 14 days, the remaining permitted scheme duration, or a 14-day extension. Critical conditions include adhering to the maximum permitted time under the specific scheme outlined in Appendix GAE schemes.

### Period of grant for the Government Authorised Exchange route

GAE 11.1. If the application is for entry clearance, the applicant will be granted for the period of the role on the Certificate of Sponsorship plus up to 14 days before and 14 days after that period (the end date of the Certificate of Sponsorship may be up to the maximum period of time that a person is permitted to spend in the UK under the terms of the specific scheme on which the applicant has applied to participate in, as set out in Appendix GAE schemes).

1.   GAE 11.2. If the application is for permission to stay, the applicant will be granted for whichever is the shortest of: 
    1.   (a) the period of the role on the Certificate of Sponsorship plus 14 days after that period (the end date of the Certificate of Sponsorship may be up to the maximum period of time permitted under the terms of the specific scheme on which the applicant has applied to participate in, as set out in Appendix GAE schemes); or
    2.   (b) where the applicant is applying to continue to participate in the same scheme, a period of 14 days plus the difference between the maximum period of time that a person on the Government Authorised Exchange route is permitted to spend in the UK under the terms of the specific approved scheme on which the applicant had applied to participate in (as set out in Appendix GAE schemes) and the period that they have already been granted permission to participate in that scheme; or
    3.   (c) the difference between 25 months and the duration of the period during which the applicant has already held continuous permission on the Government Authorised Exchange route, including any period where the Exceptions for overstayers section of Part Suitability applied.

metadata.source: Appendix Temporary Work – Government Authorised Exchange
metadata.part: Appendix Temporary Work – Government Authorised Exchange
metadata.section_title: Conditions of grant on the Government Authorised Exchange route

chunks.text:
### Conditions of grant on the Government Authorised Exchange route

1.   GAE 11.3. The grant will be subject to all the following conditions: 
    1.   (a) no access to public funds; and
    2.   (b) work is permitted only in the job the applicant is being sponsored for, including volunteering and job shadowing if recorded on the Certificate of Sponsorship; and
    3.   (c) supplementary employment is permitted; and
    4.   (d) study is permitted, subject to the ATAS condition in Appendix ATAS.
    5.   (e) DELETED.
chunks.summary: Applicants on the Government Authorised Exchange route must not access public funds, work only in their sponsored role (including volunteering and shadowing), and may undertake supplementary employment or study (with ATAS compliance). These conditions are mandatory for grant approval.

### Conditions of grant on the Government Authorised Exchange route

1.   GAE 11.3. The grant will be subject to all the following conditions: 
    1.   (a) no access to public funds; and
    2.   (b) work is permitted only in the job the applicant is being sponsored for, including volunteering and job shadowing if recorded on the Certificate of Sponsorship; and
    3.   (c) supplementary employment is permitted; and
    4.   (d) study is permitted, subject to the ATAS condition in Appendix ATAS.
    5.   (e) DELETED.

metadata.source: Appendix Temporary Work – Government Authorised Exchange
metadata.part: Appendix Temporary Work – Government Authorised Exchange
metadata.section_title: Dependants on the Government Authorised Exchange route

chunks.text: ### Dependants on the Government Authorised Exchange route
chunks.summary: Dependants on the Government Authorised Exchange route are eligible to accompany or join the main applicant. They must apply for approval and meet specific eligibility conditions, with certain exceptions and restrictions based on the exchange program type.
chunks.augmented_text:
Document: Appendix Temporary Work – Government Authorised Exchange
Part: Appendix Temporary Work – Government Authorised Exchange
Section ID: SW 3.1
Section: Dependants on the Government Authorised Exchange route
Topic: eligibility

Summary: Dependants on the Government Authorised Exchange route are eligible to accompany or join the main applicant. They must apply for approval and meet specific eligibility conditions, with certain exceptions and restrictions based on the exchange program type.

### Dependants on the Government Authorised Exchange route

metadata.source: Appendix Temporary Work – Government Authorised Exchange
metadata.part: Appendix Temporary Work – Government Authorised Exchange
metadata.section_title: Validity requirements for a dependent partner or dependent child on the Government Authorised Exchange route

chunks.text:
### Validity requirements for a dependent partner or dependent child on the Government Authorised Exchange route

GAE 12.1. A person applying for entry clearance or permission to stay as a dependent partner or dependent child on the Government Authorised Exchange route must apply online on the gov.uk website on the specified form as follows:

| Applicant | Specified form |
| --- | --- |
| EEA national with a chipped passport | Either (as applicable): • Dependant partner or dependant child using the UK Immigration: ID Check app; or • the forms listed below for dependant applicants outside or inside the UK as relevant. |
| Applicants outside the UK | Dependant partner visa Dependant child visa |
| Applicants inside the UK | If the dependant is applying at the same time as the person on the Government Authorised Exchange route, they can be included in the form Temporary Worker where the form allows dependants to be added. Otherwise: - Dependant partner - Dependant child |

1.   GAE 12.2. An application for entry clearance or permission to stay as a partner or child on the Government Authorised Exchange route must meet all the following requirements: 
    1.   (a) any fee and Immigration Health Charge must have been paid; and
    2.   (b) the applicant must have provided biometrics when required; and
    3.   (c) the applicant must have provided a passport or other travel document which satisfactorily establishes their identity and nationality; and
    4.   (d) the applicant must be applying as a partner or child of a person who: 
        1.   (i) has made a valid application for entry clearance or permission to stay as a person on the Government Authorised Exchange route that has not been decided; or
        2.   (ii) has entry clearance or permission to stay as a person on the Government Authorised Exchange route.

GAE 12.3. An applicant applying as a dependent partner must be aged 18 or over on the date of application.

GAE 12.4. If applying for permission to stay, the applicant must be in the UK on the date of application.

1.   GAE 12.4ZA. If applying for permission to stay, the applicant must not have, or have last been granted, permission: 
    1.   (a) as a Visitor; or
    2.   (b) as a Short-term Student; or
    3.   (c)as a Parent of a Child Student; or
    4.   (d) as a Seasonal Worker; or
    5.   (e) as a Domestic Worker in a Private Household; or
    6.   (f) outside the Immigration Rules.

1.   GAE 12.4A. An applicant who is applying for permission to stay and has, or last had, permission as a Student, must fulfil one of the Conditions A or B below on the date of application: 
    1.   (a) Condition A: the applicant must have completed the course of study for which the Confirmation of Acceptance for Studies was assigned (or a course to which ST 27.3 of Appendix Student applies); or
    2.   (b) Condition B: the applicant must: 
        1.   (i) be studying a full-time course of study leading to the award of a PhD with a higher education provider which has a track record of compliance; and
        2.   (ii) have completed at least 24 months of study on that course.

GAE 12.5. An application which does not meet all the validity requirements for a partner or child on the Government Authorised Exchange route may be rejected as invalid and not considered.
chunks.summary: Applicants seeking entry or stay as dependents on the Government Authorised Exchange route must apply online using specified forms, pay applicable fees and health charges, provide biometrics, and submit valid travel documents establishing identity and nationality. These requirements apply to dependents both inside and outside the UK, with specific forms for different scenarios.

These requirements apply to dependents both inside and outside the UK, with specific forms for different scenarios.

### Validity requirements for a dependent partner or dependent child on the Government Authorised Exchange route

GAE 12.1. A person applying for entry clearance or permission to stay as a dependent partner or dependent child on the Government Authorised Exchange route must apply online on the gov.uk website on the specified form as follows:

| Applicant | Specified form |
| --- | --- |
| EEA national with a chipped passport | Either (as applicable): • Dependant partner or dependant child using the UK Immigration: ID Check app; or • the forms listed below for dependant applicants outside or inside the UK as relevant. |
| Applicants outside the UK | Dependant partner visa Dependant child visa |
| Applicants inside the UK | If the dependant is applying at the same time as the person on the Government Authorised Exchange route, they can be included in the form Temporary Worker where the form allows dependants to be added. Otherwise: - Dependant partner - Dependant child |

1.   GAE 12.2. An application for entry clearance or permission to stay as a partner or child on the Government Authorised Exchange route must meet all the following requirements: 
    1.   (a) any fee and Immigration Health Charge must have been paid; and
    2.   (b) the applicant must have provided biometrics when required; and
    3.   (c) the applicant must have provided a passport or other travel document which satisfactorily establishes their identity and nationality; and
    4.   (d) the applicant must be applying as a partner or child of a person who: 
        1.   (i) has made a valid application for entry clearance or permission to stay as a person on the Government Authorised Exchange route that has not been decided; or
        2.   (ii) has entry clearance or permission to stay as a person on the Government Authorised Exchange route.

GAE 12.3. An applicant applying as a dependent partner must be aged 18 or over on the date of application.

GAE 12.4. If applying for permission to stay, the applicant must be in the UK on the date of application.

1.   GAE 12.4ZA. If applying for permission to stay, the applicant must not have, or have last been granted, permission: 
    1.   (a) as a Visitor; or
    2.   (b) as a Short-term Student; or
    3.   (c)as a Parent of a Child Student; or
    4.   (d) as a Seasonal Worker; or
    5.   (e) as a Domestic Worker in a Private Household; or
    6.   (f) outside the Immigration Rules.

1.   GAE 12.4A. An applicant who is applying for permission to stay and has, or last had, permission as a Student, must fulfil one of the Conditions A or B below on the date of application: 
    1.   (a) Condition A: the applicant must have completed the course of study for which the Confirmation of Acceptance for Studies was assigned (or a course to which ST 27.3 of Appendix Student applies); or
    2.   (b) Condition B: the applicant must: 
        1.   (i) be studying a full-time course of study leading to the award of a PhD with a higher education provider which has a track record of compliance; and
        2.   (ii) have completed at least 24 months of study on that course.

GAE 12.5. An application which does not meet all the validity requirements for a partner or child on the Government Authorised Exchange route may be rejected as invalid and not considered.

metadata.source: Appendix Temporary Work – Government Authorised Exchange
metadata.part: Appendix Temporary Work – Government Authorised Exchange
metadata.section_title: Suitability requirements for a dependent partner or dependent child on the Government Authorised Exchange route

chunks.text:
### Suitability requirements for a dependent partner or dependent child on the Government Authorised Exchange route

GAE 13.1. The applicant must not fall for refusal under Part Suitability.

1.   GAE 13.2. If applying for permission to stay the applicant must not be: 
    1.   (a) in breach of immigration laws, except that where the Exceptions for overstayers section of Part Suitability applies, that period of overstaying will be disregarded; or
    2.   (b) on immigration bail.
chunks.summary: Dependent partners or children on the Government Authorised Exchange route must satisfy suitability requirements, including not breaching immigration laws or being on immigration bail, unless specific overstaying exceptions apply.

metadata.section_id: Eligibility requirements for a dependent partner or dependent child on the Government Authorised Exchange route
metadata.section_title: Eligibility requirements for a dependent partner or dependent child on the Government Authorised Exchange route

chunks.text: ### Eligibility requirements for a dependent partner or dependent child on the Government Authorised Exchange route
chunks.summary: Dependent partners or children on the Government Authorised Exchange route must be family members of an eligible participant and meet specified eligibility criteria. They must also demonstrate genuine relationships and, where applicable, meet health and character requirements; exceptions or thresholds are outlined based on circumstances.
chunks.augmented_text:
Document: Appendix Temporary Work – Government Authorised Exchange
Part: Appendix Temporary Work – Government Authorised Exchange
Section ID: Eligibility requirements for a dependent partner or dependent child on the Government Authorised Exchange route
Section: Eligibility requirements for a dependent partner or dependent child on the Government Authorised Exchange route
Topic: eligibility

Summary: Dependent partners or children on the Government Authorised Exchange route must be family members of an eligible participant and meet specified eligibility criteria. They must also demonstrate genuine relationships and, where applicable, meet health and character requirements; exceptions or thresholds are outlined based on circumstances.

### Eligibility requirements for a dependent partner or dependent child on the Government Authorised Exchange route

metadata.source: Appendix Temporary Work – Government Authorised Exchange
metadata.part: Appendix Temporary Work – Government Authorised Exchange
metadata.section_title: Entry requirement for a dependent partner or dependent child on the Government Authorised Exchange route

chunks.text:
### Entry requirement for a dependent partner or dependent child on the Government Authorised Exchange route

GAE 14.1. A person seeking to come to the UK as a dependent partner or dependent child on the Government Authorised Exchange route must apply for and obtain entry clearance as a dependent partner or dependent child on the Government Authorised Exchange route before they arrive in the UK.

GAE 14.2. A person applying for entry clearance as the partner or child on the Government Authorised Exchange route must, if Appendix Tuberculosis applies, provide a valid medical certificate confirming that they have undergone screening for active pulmonary tuberculosis and that this tuberculosis is not present in them.
chunks.summary: Dependents (partners or children) on the Government Authorised Exchange route must obtain entry clearance before arriving in the UK, including a tuberculosis test if applicable.

GAE 14.2. A person applying for entry clearance as the partner or child on the Government Authorised Exchange route must, if Appendix Tuberculosis applies, provide a valid medical certificate confirming that they have undergone screening for active pulmonary tuberculosis and that this tuberculosis is not present in them.

metadata.section_title: Relationship requirement for a dependent partner on the Government Authorised Exchange route

chunks.text:
### Relationship requirement for a dependent partner on the Government Authorised Exchange route

1.   GAE 15.1. The applicant must be the partner of a person (P) where one of the following applies: 
    1.   (a) P has permission on the Government Authorised Exchange route; or
    2.   (b) P is, at the same time, applying for (and is granted) entry clearance or permission on the Government Authorised Exchange route.

GAE 15.2. The requirements of Appendix Relationship with Partner must be met.

GAE 15.3. DELETED.

GAE 15.4. DELETED.
chunks.summary: Dependent partners on the Government Authorised Exchange route must be partners of individuals with permission or applying for permission on the same route, and meet Appendix Relationship with Partner requirements.

GAE 15.2. The requirements of Appendix Relationship with Partner must be met.

metadata.section_title: Requirements for a dependent child on the Government Authorised Exchange route

chunks.text:
### Requirements for a dependent child on the Government Authorised Exchange route

1.   GAE 18A.1. The applicant must meet the following requirements for a dependent child in Appendix Children: 
    1.   (a) relationship requirement: entry clearance and permission to stay; and
    2.   (b) care requirement; and
    3.   (c) age and independent life requirement.
chunks.summary: Dependent children on the Government Authorised Exchange route must meet relationship, care, and age/independent life requirements, including entry clearance and permission to stay, as detailed in Appendix Children. These conditions are essential for their eligibility, with specific criteria outlined and no exceptions specified.

These conditions are essential for their eligibility, with specific criteria outlined and no exceptions specified.

### Requirements for a dependent child on the Government Authorised Exchange route

1.   GAE 18A.1. The applicant must meet the following requirements for a dependent child in Appendix Children: 
    1.   (a) relationship requirement: entry clearance and permission to stay; and
    2.   (b) care requirement; and
    3.   (c) age and independent life requirement.

metadata.source: Appendix Temporary Work – Government Authorised Exchange
metadata.part: Appendix Temporary Work – Government Authorised Exchange
metadata.section_title: Financial requirement for a dependent partner or dependent child on the Government Authorised Exchange route

chunks.text:
### Financial requirement for a dependent partner or dependent child on the Government Authorised Exchange route

GAE 19.1. If the applicant is applying for permission to stay and has been living in the UK with permission for 12 months or longer on the date of application, they will meet the financial requirement and do not need to show funds.

1.   GAE 19.2. If the applicant is applying for entry clearance, or has been in the UK for less than 12 months on the date of application, either: 
    1.   (a) funds of at least the amount required in GAE 19.3. must be held collectively by one or more of the following: 
        1.   i) the applicant; and
        2.   ii) the person on the Government Authorised Exchange route (P); and
        3.   iii) if the applicant is applying as a dependent child, their parent who is lawfully present in the UK or being granted entry clearance, or permission to stay, at the same time; or

    2.   (b) the A-rated sponsor of the person on the Government Authorised Exchange route must certify that they will, if necessary, maintain and accommodate the dependent partner and/or any dependent child as well as the person on the Government Authorised Exchange route, up to the end of the first month of each of their grants of permission, to at least the amounts required in GAE 19.3.

1.   GAE 19.3. The funds required are: 
    1.   (a) £285 for a dependent partner in the UK, or applying for entry clearance; and
    2.   (b) £315 for the first dependent child in the UK, or applying for entry clearance; and
    3.   (c) £200 for any other dependent child in the UK, or applying for entry clearance.

GAE 19.4. If GAE 19.2.(a) applies, the funds held for the applicant must be held in addition to any funds required for the person on the Government Authorised Exchange route to meet the financial requirement and any other dependants in the UK or applying at the same time.

GAE 19.5. If GAE 19.2.(a) applies, the funds must have been held for a 28-day period and as specified in Appendix Finance.
chunks.summary: Dependents applying for permission under the GAE route must hold specified funds if in the UK less than 12 months or applying for entry clearance; if in the UK for 12 months or more, they automatically meet the requirement. Funds of £285 per partner or £315 per child are needed, unless the sponsor certifies they will provide maintenance for up to the first month of permission.

### Financial requirement for a dependent partner or dependent child on the Government Authorised Exchange route

GAE 19.1. If the applicant is applying for permission to stay and has been living in the UK with permission for 12 months or longer on the date of application, they will meet the financial requirement and do not need to show funds.

1.   GAE 19.2. If the applicant is applying for entry clearance, or has been in the UK for less than 12 months on the date of application, either: 
    1.   (a) funds of at least the amount required in GAE 19.3. must be held collectively by one or more of the following: 
        1.   i) the applicant; and
        2.   ii) the person on the Government Authorised Exchange route (P); and
        3.   iii) if the applicant is applying as a dependent child, their parent who is lawfully present in the UK or being granted entry clearance, or permission to stay, at the same time; or

    2.   (b) the A-rated sponsor of the person on the Government Authorised Exchange route must certify that they will, if necessary, maintain and accommodate the dependent partner and/or any dependent child as well as the person on the Government Authorised Exchange route, up to the end of the first month of each of their grants of permission, to at least the amounts required in GAE 19.3.

1.   GAE 19.3. The funds required are: 
    1.   (a) £285 for a dependent partner in the UK, or applying for entry clearance; and
    2.   (b) £315 for the first dependent child in the UK, or applying for entry clearance; and
    3.   (c) £200 for any other dependent child in the UK, or applying for entry clearance.

GAE 19.4. If GAE 19.2.(a) applies, the funds held for the applicant must be held in addition to any funds required for the person on the Government Authorised Exchange route to meet the financial requirement and any other dependants in the UK or applying at the same time.

GAE 19.5. If GAE 19.2.(a) applies, the funds must have been held for a 28-day period and as specified in Appendix Finance.

metadata.source: Appendix Temporary Work – Government Authorised Exchange
metadata.part: Appendix Temporary Work – Government Authorised Exchange
metadata.section_title: Decision on an application as a dependent partner or dependent child on the Government Authorised Exchange route

chunks.text:
### Decision on an application as a dependent partner or dependent child on the Government Authorised Exchange route

GAE 20.1. If the decision maker is satisfied that all the suitability and eligibility requirements for a dependent partner or dependent child on the Government Authorised Exchange route are met, the application will be granted, otherwise the application will be refused.

GAE 20.2 If the application is refused, the person can apply for an Administrative Review under Appendix AR: Administrative Review.
chunks.summary: This provision applies to dependent partners or children applying under the Government Authorised Exchange route. The decision-maker must ensure all suitability and eligibility criteria are met; if so, the application is granted, otherwise refused, with the applicant able to request an Administrative Review.

### Decision on an application as a dependent partner or dependent child on the Government Authorised Exchange route

GAE 20.1. If the decision maker is satisfied that all the suitability and eligibility requirements for a dependent partner or dependent child on the Government Authorised Exchange route are met, the application will be granted, otherwise the application will be refused.

GAE 20.2 If the application is refused, the person can apply for an Administrative Review under Appendix AR: Administrative Review.

metadata.source: Appendix Temporary Work – Government Authorised Exchange
metadata.part: Appendix Temporary Work – Government Authorised Exchange
metadata.section_title: Period of grant for a dependent partner or dependent child on the Government Authorised Exchange route

chunks.text:
### Period of grant for a dependent partner or dependent child on the Government Authorised Exchange route

GAE 21.1. A partner will be granted permission which ends on the same date as their partner’s permission on the Government Authorised Exchange route.

GAE 21.2. A child will be granted permission which ends on the same date as whichever of their parents’ permission ends first.
chunks.summary: Dependent partners and children on the Government Authorised Exchange route must have their permission end date aligned with that of their primary applicant, with partners sharing the same expiry date and children’s permissions ending when either parent’s permission concludes.
chunks.augmented_text:

### Period of grant for a dependent partner or dependent child on the Government Authorised Exchange route

GAE 21.1. A partner will be granted permission which ends on the same date as their partner’s permission on the Government Authorised Exchange route.

GAE 21.2. A child will be granted permission which ends on the same date as whichever of their parents’ permission ends first.

metadata.source: Appendix Temporary Work – Government Authorised Exchange
metadata.part: Appendix Temporary Work – Government Authorised Exchange
metadata.section_title: Conditions of grant for a dependent partner or dependent child on the Government Authorised Exchange route

chunks.text:
### Conditions of grant for a dependent partner or dependent child on the Government Authorised Exchange route

1.   GAE 21.3. The grant will be subject to all the following conditions: 
    1.   (a) no access to public funds; and
    2.   (b) work (including self-employment and voluntary work) is permitted, except as a professional sportsperson (including as a sports coach); and
    3.   (c) study is permitted, subject to the ATAS condition in Appendix ATAS if the applicant is over the age of 18.
    4.   (d) DELETED.

Print this page
chunks.summary: Dependent partners and children on the Government Authorised Exchange route may work, study (with ATAS if over 18), but cannot access public funds or work as professional sportspersons.
